internal.content:
---
title: Upgrade Execution
tabs: ['Upgrade', 'OpenShift', 'Users', 'Manage', 'Customization']  
---           
 
Follow the steps to Upgrade your existing Maximi environment:

## Prepare Database
- Prepare your database by duplicating the existing Maximo production database.

## Install Maximo Application Suite (MAS)
- Save superuser credentials and admin url from the MAS installtion summary. 

## Prepare Customization Archive
- Skip this step if you don't have customization.
- Follow [Customization](customizationprocess) page. Sample [customization archive](https://github.com/ibm-mas-manage/playbook/blob/master/customization)

## Deploy and Configure Manage 
### 1. Go to Maximo Application Suite (MAS)
- Go to your admin link : admin.{{instance_id}}{{domain_id}} from MAS installation.
- user your super credentials to login (from MAS Installation).

![image](images/suite.png)     

### 2. System Configuration 
- Go to Configuration tile.
- Configure SMTP 
  - SMTP configuration will be used to send welcome emails to the users. During upgrade, all the Maximo users will be migrated to Manage. 
  - The maxadmin user will be created automatically with password maxadminmaxadmin#1. You can update the password from the user page.

Sample:

![image](images/smtp.png)  

### 3. Configure and Deploy Manage, Industry Solutions and Addons
- Go to Catalog, click Manage.


![image](images/managetile.png) 


- Select Manage, Industry Solutions and Addons.



![image](images/addon.png)  


- Deploy 


![image](images/managedeploy.png)  

- Configure
  - Go to Actions on the top right of the page. Select Configure Workspace.


  ![image](images/configurews.png)  

  - Configure database
    - Click on configure 


  ![image](images/dbconfigure.png)  




  ![image](images/dbconnection.png)  


 - Configure schema, tablespace, certificates.



  ![image](images/databaseconf.png)  



  - Configure languages, server bundles.

  
  ![image](images/langserver.png) 

  - Configure Customization Archieve if needed.


  ![image](images/customization.png) 

### 4. Activate 

   - Click on Activate blue button on top right when you see ready to be activated message.

     ![image](images/activate.png)  
   
### 5. Manage available

![image](images/active.png)  
   

### 6. Create Admin User
   - Create an admin user from Users page.
    Sample:
    ![image](images/newuser.png)

MdxNode.rawBody:
---
title: Upgrade Execution
tabs: ['Upgrade', 'OpenShift', 'Users', 'Manage', 'Customization']  
---           
 
Follow the steps to Upgrade your existing Maximi environment:

## Prepare Database
- Prepare your database by duplicating the existing Maximo production database.

## Install Maximo Application Suite (MAS)
- Save superuser credentials and admin url from the MAS installtion summary. 

## Prepare Customization Archive
- Skip this step if you don't have customization.
- Follow [Customization](customizationprocess) page. Sample [customization archive](https://github.com/ibm-mas-manage/playbook/blob/master/customization)

## Deploy and Configure Manage 
### 1. Go to Maximo Application Suite (MAS)
- Go to your admin link : admin.{{instance_id}}{{domain_id}} from MAS installation.
- user your super credentials to login (from MAS Installation).

![image](images/suite.png)     

### 2. System Configuration 
- Go to Configuration tile.
- Configure SMTP 
  - SMTP configuration will be used to send welcome emails to the users. During upgrade, all the Maximo users will be migrated to Manage. 
  - The maxadmin user will be created automatically with password maxadminmaxadmin#1. You can update the password from the user page.

Sample:

![image](images/smtp.png)  

### 3. Configure and Deploy Manage, Industry Solutions and Addons
- Go to Catalog, click Manage.


![image](images/managetile.png) 


- Select Manage, Industry Solutions and Addons.



![image](images/addon.png)  


- Deploy 


![image](images/managedeploy.png)  

- Configure
  - Go to Actions on the top right of the page. Select Configure Workspace.


  ![image](images/configurews.png)  

  - Configure database
    - Click on configure 


  ![image](images/dbconfigure.png)  




  ![image](images/dbconnection.png)  


 - Configure schema, tablespace, certificates.



  ![image](images/databaseconf.png)  



  - Configure languages, server bundles.

  
  ![image](images/langserver.png) 

  - Configure Customization Archieve if needed.


  ![image](images/customization.png) 

### 4. Activate 

   - Click on Activate blue button on top right when you see ready to be activated message.

     ![image](images/activate.png)  
   
### 5. Manage available

![image](images/active.png)  
   

### 6. Create Admin User
   - Create an admin user from Users page.
    Sample:
    ![image](images/newuser.png)
